content.description:
Start up a gully and continue to iced slabs to a traverse up and left to a high pillar. The first few hundred feet are WI2/3 with some M3/4. The pillar is a fun WI4. Another mellow pitch to the top. Walk off to the right.



The obvious northwest facing route.

Rack to 3 inches, pitons, ice gear

North-facing bowl with three known ice climbs: Mad House and these: Logger's Root 30m, WI2+; FA- Greg Cornell, Dec3/02 (Climb fat rolls of ice to a 4m near vertical finish. Forms early, fat and wide, nice lounging area, good for beginners. Rap off trees) / High Plains Drifter 85m, WI3; FA-Greg Cornell (As for Logger's Root, continue up the drainage to an impasse, gain the right hillside and stay on it overlooking the gulley between the 3rd and 4th Numbered Buttresses to the open alpine bowl.(1.5 hrs from Logger's Root) The waterfall is up on the right 10 min. further. This route is easily visible from the west highway overpass in Canmore and spills over a cliffband on the 4th Buttress in the far back bowl. It looks like the letter "S." Climb to a ledge that is thin in spots. Go to the top on better ice; grade 3 ice entire way. Rap from threads, enjoying the huge alpine environment above the town. Avalanche danger)
